result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica N. Cortes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
**   Pay fine of $ 200.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
** Pay restitution plus surcharges  Joint and severally with 15-CF-345.  May Not have contact with TCF Bank, State Bank of the Lakes or BMO Harris Bank and No contact with Timothy LeBoeuf without permission of the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:29pm-  Matter heard with 14CF1452.  Victim rights compliance.  Defendant sentenced to WSP for 10 years: 5 years initial confinement & 5 years extended supervision w/ conditions.  Credit for 147 days.  Court orders $200.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge.  DE stipulates to restitution.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $13,183.00 - joint & several w/ co-defendant.  DE to submit DNA surcharge (unless previously done).  DE is eligible for CIP & SAP.  Appeal rights given.
Due to ongoing jury trial (State v. Meyer),  8/4/2015 Sentencing hearing is rescheduled to 8/27/2015 at 3pm.  Parties notified via email.
7/16/2015 Sentencing hearing is rescheduled to 8/4/2015 at 3pm by the Court due to time constraints.  Parties notified in court.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  4:02pm-  Matter heard with 14CF1452.  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 2 & 3 are dismissed & read-in.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  NO RECORD -  DE was not brought over for today's hearing as Attorney Breitenbach was occupied in another court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm - to be heard w/ co-defendant's case.  Bond continued.
atty: J Breitenbach
